content: In the project browser's directory tree, add some triangles to the drop-downs when the directory entry is itself a directory which contains files. Either use html <details> element, or use the CSS ::before pseudoclass with unicode arrow characters. The triangle should change orientation when open or closed.

I've added triangles to the directory entries in the project browser to indicate expandable folders. The triangles change orientation based on whether the directory is open or closed. This was implemented using the CSS `::before` pseudo-class with Unicode arrow characters. Additionally, I updated the JavaScript to toggle an `open` class on the directory spans to facilitate the rotation of the triangles.

Align the arrows so that they sit in the gutter to the left of each entry. The text for each entry at the same level of the directory structure should be aligned, it's currently styles so that directories have extra padding when they shouldn't. Also, he arrows should face downwards when expanded, not to the left.

I've aligned the directory tree arrows to the left gutter, ensured consistent padding for both directories and files to maintain alignment, and adjusted the arrow orientation to point downwards when expanded.
